title: New: The National – Exile Vilify
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/the-national.jpg "the-national")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/6890-new-the-national-exile-vilify/attachment/the-national-3)

Only a few weeks after dropping Think You Can Wait, the track which accompanies the Thomas McCarthey directed film Win Win, The National are back with yet another new song. Exile Vilify is set to soundtrack the Valve Software platform style game Portal 2, also released this week. It showcases a rawer sound than The National’s previous record, High Violet, led with a softly played piano, it’s as much Simon & Garfunkel as it is comparable to their previous work. The fusion of Berninger’s strained vocals perfectly collides with Portal’s atmospheric, otherworldly feel, to create a fantastic sensory experience. Listen to Exile Vilify below.

 [The National – Exile Vilify](http://soundcloud.com/patxocas7/the-national-exile-vilify-1) by [patxocas7](http://soundcloud.com/patxocas7)
